author: tmichael
title: When is George Michael’s funeral, what was the singer’s cause of death and who will inherit his fortune?
text:
Opinion DON'T LET THE SUN GO DOWN When is George Michael’s funeral, what was the singer’s cause of death and who will inherit his fortune? 
Family and friends are enduring an agonising wait to lay legendary Wham! singer to rest BY TOM MICHAEL AND TOM GILLESPIE 5th February 2017, 10:39 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments GEORGE Michael’s family are still awaiting the results of a toxicology report more than a month after the singer was found dead at his Oxfordshire home. 
Michael’s body has not yet been released as a coroner waits to see if drug intake contributed to his death. 
On February 5, The Sun exclusively revealed that the singer’s family may have to wait until March before his body is released as test delays drag on. Splash News 1 George Michael died on December 25 2016 
George Michael was found dead in his bed on Christmas Day. We take a look at when the funeral will be held, the possible causes of Michael’s death, and how much his relatives and godchildren stand to inherit. When is George Michael’s funeral? 
George Michael is expected to have two funerals – one for close pals and family and one for his extended circle of friends. 
The services were expected to take place in January but could be postponed for longer as delays rumble on. 
Thames Valley Police are still awaiting the results of toxicology tests on his organs to work out what caused his death. 
Detectives have said his death is being treated as “non-suspicious”. 
Michael’s funeral cannot take place until his body has been released by the coroner. 
It has been rumoured his pal Sir Elton John could perform at one of the events. 
He was reportedly left “physically shaking” after singing their 1991 collaboration Don’t Let The Sun Go Down On Me – the song he is rumoured to be planning to play at the service. 
Elton famously sang Goodbye England’s Rose at Princess Diana’s funeral in 1997. George Michael performs Don't Let the Sun Go Down on Me with Elton John What was the singer’s cause of death? 
Despite initial unverified reports that George died of congestive heart failure, the exact cause of his sudden and unexpected death remains unclear. 
A post-mortem examination of the star’s body came back “inconclusive” and cops are still awaiting the results of the toxicology report. 
An earlier police statement read: “A Post Mortem examination was carried out yesterday as part of the investigation into the death of George Michael. 
“The cause of death is inconclusive and further tests will now be carried out. The results of these tests are unlikely to be known for several weeks. 
“Thames Valley Police will prepare a file for the Oxfordshire Coroner. 
“Mr Michael’s death is still being treated as unexplained but not suspicious.” Who will inherit George Michael’s fortune? 
Prior to his tragic death at the age of just 53, George is believed to have amassed a huge fortune worth a reported £105million. 
He raked in huge sums over the years, with his accounts showing he earned more than £48million from touring between April 2006 and March 2008 alone. 
And with no husband, children or any obvious heirs there has been some speculation over what will happen to his estate. 
It has not yet been confirmed who will inherit the Wham! singer’s fortune, but there is a shortlist of his nearest and dearest who are expected to be remembered in his will.
